page.title: 14GOOLE - PUBLIC LEISURE
page.content: The working people of Goole have time for{leisure}pursuits in the evenings, weekends or at holiday times - except for the shift workers and unemployed. Leisure is limited by money, age, health, attitude or lack of energy. In Goole, people have the{opportunity to join the uniformed organisations, youth clubs,jazz bands, football teams, swimming and athletics clubs and brass band. Many{different}sports are offered at the leisure centre. Older people have organisations like Lions, Round Table, Rotary, Freemasons and Luncheon Clubs. There are also many church, women's, charity and sports groups .Darts and dominoes are played as league games in many pubs. There are community centres, Men's Forum, Derby and Joan clubs or evening institute classes. Most of these are {group}pursuits.
